## Intro to R
<hr>

This series of tutorials teaches the basics of importing data, using new packages, cleaning and summarizing data with __tidy__ tools, and using `ggplot2` to make charts and other data visualizations.

<div class="column3">

1. Create a new RStudio project and R script.
1. Install new R packages.
1. Create variables, lists, data frames.
1. Read data into R.
1. Arrange and filter your data. 
1. Solve a cat mystery.
1. Become a pet detective.

Packages: `readr`, `dplyr`

</div>

<div class="column3"> 

1. Data transformations
    - Add new columns.
    - Summarize your data.
    - Split groups and categories in your data.
    - Save data.

2. Make __plots__.
    - Scatter plots and transparency.
    - Add a smoothed trend line to the plot.
    - Add titles, colors, and axis labels.
    - Bar charts.
    - Histograms.

Packages: `ggplot2`

</div> 

<div class="column3">

1. Read data from Excel.
1. Make more __plots__.
    - Add titles, colors, and axis labels.
    - Box plots.
    - Bar plots.
    - Label points.
    - Log transform your chart axis. 
    - Save charts to different formats.
1. Connect to __TEMPO__.
    - View tables.
    - Read data.


Packages: `readxl`, `tidyr`, `leaflet`, `RODBC`, `lubridate`

</div>
